title: Joey Barton pleads not guilty to causing actual bodily harm to Daniel Stendel

Joey Barton has pleaded not guilty to causing Daniel Stendel actual bodily harm.

Barton was charged following an alleged attack on former Barnsley manager Daniel Stendel following a match during last season.

Police were called to the tunnel area of the stadium after Barnsley defeated Barton's Fleetwood Town 4-2 in a League One game on April 13 earlier this year.

Barton, 36, of Widnes, Cheshire, is charged with causing actual bodily harm to Stendel and appeared at Barnsley Magistrates' Court on Wednesday.

The Crown Prosecution Service said Stendel sustained damage to a tooth and required emergency dental treatment that is ongoing. His face allegedly struck a metal pole in the tunnel at Oakwell.

Barton, who denies any involvement, will appear at Sheffield Crown Court on November 6.

(Image: Daily Mirror/Andy Stenning)

(Image: Dan Rowlands / SWNS)

Barnsley lodged formal complaints with the English Football Leagueand the Football Association over the alleged incident.

TV footage showed police trying to stop Barton from leaving Oakwell Stadium shortly after the alleged clash is said to have taken place.

Barton has only once previously spoken about the alleged clash with Stendel, taking to Twitter three days following the match.

(Image: Dan Rowlands / SWNS)

(Image: EMPICS Sport)

"With regards to the alleged incident on Saturday following our game against Barnsley, I emphatically deny all the allegations made," he tweeted.

"Given this matter has not been formally closed, it would be inappropriate for me to make any further comment."

(Image: PA)

Barton has been in charge of Fleetwood since the summer of 2018 and oversaw an inconsistent campaign last season.

However, he has now guided them to third in the current League One standings.

Barnsley were promoted under Stendel last year but he lost his job earlier this week after a poor run of results in the Championship.

The Tykes find themselves 23rd in the table with just one win from their 11 league games this season.
description: Barton appeared at The Court House in Barnsley on Wednesday afternoon charged with an alleged attack on a rival manager
